column4: HI, is there a some command that tells me what bits (32 or 64) my computer is?
try running in a terminal: cat /proc/cpuinfo
nano shows info, but gedit shows empty blank page! why is that?
dunno, it is not a normal file, it's generated on the fly by the kernel when you access it
I tried cat, sane as nano, I can see info, but nothing that tells me what I need
this command is better: lshw -class processor
